intro: Corysanthes bancana, commonly known as the Banksia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical or bottle-shaped flower spikes. The plant produces woody cones that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. Corysanthes bancana is typically found in coastal and sandy soils, often in heathlands and forests. It plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, particularly birds and insects.
